value.title: Spain to launch plan to tackle economic impact of coronavirus, PM says
value.excerpt: MADRID (Reuters) - Spain’s government has prepared an emergency plan to deal with the economic consequences of the coronavirus, which it plans to launch “as soon as possible,” Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Monday. Without providing any details, Sanchez said the government has been working on the plan for two weeks and is now ready ...

value.excerpt: European markets are expected to open higher Tuesday after stocks on Wall Street saw their worst day since the 2008 financial crisis in the previous trading session.

value.title: Wizz Air Suspends All Flights to Italy, Israel Over Coronavirus
value.excerpt: Wizz Air has suspended all flights to Italy and Israel after the two countries announced plans to try to beat Europe's worst outbreak of coronavirus, the low-cost carrier said on Tuesday. Flights to and from Italian airports will be cancelled from March 10 until April 3 and flights serving Israel's Tel Aviv and Eilat will be suspended from March 12 until March 23,

value.title: Deutsche Bank splits London trading teams as coronavirus precaution
value.excerpt: FRANKFURT, March 9 (Reuters) - Deutsche Bank has split some of its trading teams in London across different locations as a precaution against the spread of the coronavirus, the lender said on Monday. The split is among the bank’s main offices and a disaster recovery site while some staff may work from home, the bank said. The move is similar ...

value.title: Factbox: Italy orders nationwide lockdown to combat back coronavirus
value.excerpt: (Reuters) - The whole of Italy will be placed under lockdown until next month, Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte announced on Monday, in an unprecedented new attempt to beat coronavirus in Europe’s worst-affected country. The decree says people should only move around for reasons of work, for health needs or for emergencies. Public transport will ...

value.title: Madonna cancels Paris shows after France limits crowds amid coronavirus concerns
value.excerpt: NEW YORK — Madonna has cancelled the last two stops of her latest tour in France after the country said it was banning events of more than 1,000 people to limit the spread of the coronavirus. value.title: Movement restricted across Italy in new coronavirus crackdown: PM Conte
value.excerpt: Movement across Italy will be sharply restricted in a dramatic new clampdown aimed at halting the spread of the coronavirus, Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said on Monday. Conte told reporters that measures introduced just two days ago in much of the north were no longer sufficient and that they would have to be extended to the whole country from Tuesday.

value.title: Italy expands travel restrictions to entire country to contain coronavirus

Conte said Monday night that a new government decree will require people throughout the country of 60 million people to demonstrate a need to ...

value.title: The coronavirus is another test for Europe. Working together will be key.
value.excerpt: There seems to be a pattern. As soon as new European Union leadership assumes office in Brussels and begins to outline its plans for the years ahead, a crisis erupts to dominate everything. A decade ago, it was the debt crisis that followed the global financial crash. It was messy for a while, but things were gradually brought under control.

value.title: Six die in Italy prison riot over anti-coronavirus measures
value.excerpt: Seven prisoners have died as riots spread through crowded jails across Italy over measures imposed to contain the coronavirus. Inmates, many angered by restrictions on family visits, went on the rampage and started fires from Sunday into Monday,

value.title: ANALYSIS-Coronavirus to drive European airline industry shakeout

value.title: Drive-in coronavirus testing in Germany
value.excerpt: World stocks tumbled overnight with investors bracing for the economic fallout of the epidemic, with a shocking all-out oil price war adding to anxiety. London's FTSE 100 plunged to a three-year low as Wall Street was preparing for a bloodbath Monday after oil prices cratered by 30 percent overnight.

value.title: Italy to suspend all sporting events in the country through April 3 because of coronavirus
value.excerpt: The Italian Olympic Committee announced Monday that the country has suspended all sports in the country — behind closed doors or otherwise — until April 3, the latest and most dramatic step taken in the sporting world to curtail the spread of the novel coronavirus. The committee, which oversees all sports in the country, said in a ...
